SEARCH
Package project.testmaster.backend.controller

Class StudentController

java.lang.Object
project.testmaster.backend.controller.StudentController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/student") public class StudentController extends Object
Controller class handling student-related operations. This class provides REST endpoints for exam-related actions, such as starting, submitting, and saving exams, as well as retrieving exam results.

  • Method Details

    • getExam

      @PostMapping(path="exam/session") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<SessionResponseDTO> getExam(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid SessionRequestDTO request)
      Retrieves an exam session including questions, answers, start time, end time, and other details. This method processes the exam session requested by a student and returns the relevant data.
      Parameters:
      request - the session request containing details such as exam ID and attempt ID
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the session response, including the exam questions, answers, start and end times, and submission status; or an error response in case of failure

    • startExam

      @PostMapping(path="exam/start") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<StartExamResponseDTO> startExam(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid StartExamRequestDTO request)
      Starts an exam session for a student.
      Parameters:
      request - the request object containing details for starting the exam, including the exam ID and passcode
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a StartExamResponseDTO if the exam session is successfully started, or an appropriate error response for failure scenarios

    • submitExam

      @PostMapping(path="exam/submit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> submitExam(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid ExamSubmitRequestDTO request)
      Submits an exam session for a student. This method processes the student's answers and registers their submission for the specified exam.
      Parameters:
      request - the request payload containing the exam information, including the exam ID, attempt ID, and the student's answers to the exam questions
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity indicating the outcome of the submission. Possible responses are: - HTTP 200: The exam session was successfully submitted. - HTTP 401: Unauthorized access, indicating the user is not authenticated. - HTTP 403: Forbidden, indicating the user does not have proper permissions. - HTTP 404: The specified exam was not found. - HTTP 500: An internal server error occurred while submitting the exam.

    • saveSession

      @PostMapping(path="exam/save") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> saveSession(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid ExamSubmitRequestDTO request)
      Saves an exam session provided by the user.
      Parameters:
      request - The request object containing exam details including attempt ID, exam ID, student answers, and other required information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the outcome of the save operation. Possible responses: - 200 OK: Exam session saved successfully. - 401 Unauthorized: User is not authorized to save the exam session. - 404 Not Found: Exam or related resources could not be found. - 500 Internal Server Error: An error occurred while saving the exam session.

    • getExamResults

      @GetMapping(path="exam/results") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<ExamResultDTO>> getExamResults()
      Retrieves a list of exam results for the currently authenticated student. The method fetches exam results, filters those that have been submitted, and converts them to ExamResultDTO objects.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing a list of ExamResultDTO objects if successful, or an appropriate HTTP status code if an error occurs.

    • getExamResult

      @GetMapping(path="exam/result") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<ExamResultDTO>> getExamResult(@Valid @RequestParam(name="examId") @Valid UUID examId)
      Retrieves the results of an exam for the current student user.
      Parameters:
      examId - the unique identifier of the exam to retrieve results for
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a list of ExamResultDTO objects representing the exam results if the operation is successful, or an appropriate HTTP status code if an error occurs
